article:
A number of online neuroscience databases are available which provide
information regarding gene expression, neurons, macroscopic brain structure,
and neurological or psychiatric disorders. While some databases contain
descriptive and numerical data, others include postmortem brain sections or 3D
MRI and fMRI images.

A list that is regularly updated can be found at the [https://neuinfo.org/mynif-
/search.php?q=database&first=true&t=indexable&nif=nlx_144509-1 Neuroscience
Information Framework database list], which contains over 2500 databases
relevant to neuroscience.

   

{| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size: 85%; text-align: center;
width: auto"

! neuron, macroscopic) Data (MRI, fMRI, images, descriptive, numerical) Disorder
! Register to view data? Ref

! Atlas, stained sections from brains showing development and gene expression

! Structural MRI images Human Macroscopic MRI datasets Healthy and Alzheimer's
! Disease Yes 
|-

!| [http://sites.google.com/site/bipolardatabase/]
! Meta-analysis and database of MRI studies Human Macroscopic Descriptive,
! numerical Bipolar Disorder No 
|-

! Structural MRI images and Atlases Human Macroscopic MRI datasets Fetuses,

! Atlas, schematic atlas of Macaca fascicularis Macaque Macroscopic Schematic
! images Healthy Yes

|-
!| Brain Machine Interface Platform [http://bmi.neuroinf.jp/]
! Different types of data related to brain machine interface Human, Monkey
! Macroscopic, Neuron Images, Numerical Healthy No
!
|-
!| BrainMap.org [http://brainmap.org/]
! fMRI coordinate database Human Macroscopic Descriptive Healthy Yes

!| BrainMaps [http://brainmaps.org/]
! Atlas, high resolution stained sections from brains Human, primate and non-
! primate (14 species in all) Neuron and Macroscopic Images Healthy No
! 
|-

! fMRI and PET coordinate database Human Macroscopic Descriptive Healthy No
! Nielsen, F.A. (2003).
! [http://www2.imm.dtu.dk/pubdb/views/edoc_download.php/2879/pdf/imm2879.pdf The
! Brede database: a small database for functional neuroimaging] NeuroImage
! 19(2), Presented at the 9th International Conference on Functional Mapping of

!| Brainmuseum.org / MSU Brain Biodiversity Bank

|-
!| Cerebellar Development Transcriptome Database
!| [http://www.cdtdb.brain.riken.jp/CDT/Top.jsp]

|-
!| Collaborative Research in Computational Neuroscience [http://crcns.org]
! Many kinds of neuroscience results that are relevant for modeling Human and
! several other species Multiscale Spike trains, LFP, MUA, MRI Healthy Yes
!
|-
!| Database for Reaching Experiments And Models (DREAM) [http://crcns.org/hosted-
!| projects/dream/]
! Reaching data. (Behavioral, generalization, adaptation, learning, spike, fMRI,
! uncertainty) Human and monkey Macroscopic Kinematic, Spike, fMRI Healthy Yes
!
|-
!| The fMRI Data Center [http://www.fmridc.org]
! fMRI datasets from published studies Human Macroscopic fMRI datasets Healthy
! Yes Van Horn JD, Grethe JS, Kostelec P, Woodward JB, Aslam JA, Rus D,
! Rockmore D, Gazzaniga MS (2001)
[http://rstb.royalsocietypublishing.org/content/356/1412/1323.long The
Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging Data Center (fMRIDC): the challenges and
rewards of large-scale databasing of neuroimaging studies]Philos Trans R Soc
Lond B Biol Sci Aug 29;356(1412):1323-39
|-
!| Invertebrate Brain Platform [http://invbrain.neuroinf.jp/modules/tinyd0/]

! Database of Neuron properties and classification Human Neuron Descriptive

! morphology], J Neurosci Methods. 1 July 1998;82(1):105-21.
|-

!| atabase&first=true&t=indexable&nif=nlx_144509-1]
! actually a meta database of neuroscience-relevant data incorporating over 100
! databases like brainmaps, BREDE, ABA, MGI etc. Human, Mouse, Rat, Worm
! Microscopic, Macroscopic Datasets Healthy and Diseased No

! Atlas, Structural MRI images and PET images Human Macroscopic Images Healthy
